title: 115_s869
content: Repeal of withholding and reporting requirements for certain foreign accounts. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking chapter 4 and making various conforming amendments related to electronically filed returns, substitute dividends, and other provisions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include taxes and tax imposed by chapter 3. Various sections are amended by striking references to chapter 4. The effective date for these amendments is after the enactment of this Act. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include taxes and tax imposed by chapter 3, with references to chapter 4 being struck. Additionally, the repeal of information reporting with respect to foreign financial assets is implemented. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing section 6038D and modifying the statute of limitations for significant omission of income related to foreign assets. The amendment includes changes to section 6501(e) regarding the omission of gross income exceeding 25 percent. The tax may be assessed or court proceedings for tax collection may begin within 6 years if the omitted income exceeds 25% of gross income. Amendments to sections 6229(c) and 6501(c) remove certain references and clarify the threshold for significant income omission. The amendments made by this section remove section 6038D from the tax code's table of sections. These changes apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act, with specific provisions for returns filed after the enactment date. SEC. 3. Repeal of penalties for underpayments related to undisclosed foreign financial assets. Amends Section 6662 of the Internal Revenue Code by removing penalties and updating subsections. Effective for taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Repeal of reporting activities for passive foreign investment companies. SEC. 5. Repeal of reporting requirement for United States owners of foreign trusts. Amends section 6048(b) by removing the obligation to submit information prescribed by the Secretary for taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 6. Repeal of minimum penalty for failure to report on certain foreign trusts. Section 6677(a) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to remove the minimum penalty amount and cap the penalty at the gross reportable amount. These amendments apply to notices and returns filed after the enactment of the Act.
